aws_appmesh_route.description: Provides an AWS App Mesh route resource.

name.description: A name for the HTTP header in the client request that will be matched on.

mesh_name.description: The name of the service mesh in which to create the route.

virtual_router_name.description: The name of the virtual router in which to create the route.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource.

http_route.description: The HTTP routing information for the route.

priority.description: The priority for the route, between `0` and `1000`.

tcp_route.description: The TCP routing information for the route.

action.description: The action to take if a match is determined.

match.description: The method and value to match the header value sent with a request. Specify one match method.

weighted_target.description: The targets that traffic is routed to when a request matches the route.

prefix.description: The header value sent by the client must begin with the specified characters.

header.description: The client request headers to match on.

method.description: The client request header method to match on. Valid values: `GET`, `HEAD`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `CONNECT`, `OPTIONS`, `TRACE`, `PATCH`.

scheme.description: The client request header scheme to match on. Valid values: `http`, `https`.

virtual_node.description: The virtual node to associate with the weighted target.

weight.description: The relative weight of the weighted target. An integer between 0 and 100.

invert.description: If `true`, the match is on the opposite of the `match` method and value. Default is `false`.

exact.description: The header value sent by the client must match the specified value exactly.

range.description: The object that specifies the range of numbers that the header value sent by the client must be included in.

regex.description: The header value sent by the client must include the specified characters.

suffix.description: The header value sent by the client must end with the specified characters.

created_date.description: The creation date of the route.

last_updated_date.description: The last update date of the route.
